message: Ranjith co-founded YouSendIt and started his lastest company, PunchTab, in January. PunchTab makes it easy for any content site to reward the loyalty of its readers. Post your questions here -- Jason may pose them to Ranjith during the LIVE show on Tuesday at 1pm PST.
I'd love to know how they handle the takedown notices from people uploading pirated content and whether it's taken significant staff to handle it or if they have an automated process.

@TurtleboyGames, happy to connect you with the folks at YouSendIt but in a nutshell we support a standard DMCA takedown procedure for copyright holders.  Let's get some PunchTab questions going too!  http://www.punchtab.com
This is one site using PunchTab: http://www.modsentry.com Try it out -- and share here what you think.
nginx
all good now :)
me too, nice work!
i'll keep an eye on it.
Ranjith is here and getting set up in the studio! He said his co-founder will be in Convore during the show to answer questions, but we'll pass questions on to Jason as well.
thanks for your patience!
Hello All. I'm Ranjith's co-founder. I'm here to answer your questions!
@ericflo  www.punchtab.com is running smoothly on our side (keeping our finger crossed).
Q: Why the name PunchTab?
@ericflo let me look into it
Why only FB sign up?
Is punchtab.com down?
@Ade_Lack Facebook is the single most used authentication system. This was our first choice. Twitter will be coming.
uh oh!
what about now?
@mehdi I just got a 504 Gateway Time-out
@mehdi ^same
great.
Yep it is crashed
@mehdi I got in
Q: Who's responsible for securing the rewards? And are their a variety of awards to cater to specific audiences? For example, a site or blog that focuses on women of color?
If Jason doesn't answer, @mehdi feel free to answer!
thanks @kirinkalia !
@kirinkalia I'll keep my ears open
That's actually on our question list already -- will PunchTab also allow people to connect through Twitter?
@Mpressme thanks for posting the question here as well!
Thanks @Mpressme, added this to the doc we're sharing with Jason

Q: How do you vaildate the user interaction? For example, Jason earned points on the site, but without even glancing at the content? So what's to stop someone from just jumping from site to site, and racking up the points?

@Mpressme it's catchy, there is a reference to the "tab" that you can see on www.punchtab.com, and it's also a reference to "punch" like in a punch card when you are a loyal customer of a sandwich shop.
@Mpressme I'll leave some of those great questions for the live show.
if Jason doesn't ask (oops)
yeah. I'll stay after the show!
@Mpressme i'm going to answer your question now since Jason didn't get to ask.
From the ASK JASON segment: http://bit.ly/jason-domain & http://bit.ly/domain-fred

We have 2 solutions for the rewards:
1/ During our beta program, we sponsor the rewards (we currently have amazon, itunes and starbucks gift cards)
2/ If you want to create your custom rewards for your site, you do so. You will have to secure it.
@mehdi... thanks!
You can tailor the offer yourself with the custom reward, but we will definitely improve the platform to tailor categories depending on the site/blog.
thanks @mehdi @ranjithkumaran  @kirinkalia Good show and an interesting startup :)
thanks @Mpressme great questions ;)
